items.title: Drama voor Oranje-opponent Japan: belangrijke pion scheurt kruisband
items.summary: Japan lijkt tijdens het WK van volgend jaar geen beroep te kunnen doen op Takumi Minamino. De aanvallende middenvelder van AS Monaco heeft zondag zijn kruisband gescheurd en wacht een lang revalidatietraject. Dat betekent dat Minamino hoogstwaarschijnlijk niet in actie kan komen tegen het Nederlands elftal op het WK.

items.title: Dalot: Fernandes injury 'massive' blow to Utd
items.summary: Diogo Dalot called Bruno Fernandes' injury a "massive" blow as Manchester United wait to find out the severity of the skipper's setback.

items.title: Arteta: Jesus could start in cup against Palace
items.summary: Mikel Arteta hinted he was ready to hand Gabriel Jesus his first start in 345 days in Arsenal's Carabao Cup quarterfinal clash against Crystal Palace.

items.title: Kane smashes Arjen Robben record in Bayern rout
items.summary: Harry Kane scored his 30th club goal of the season as Bayern Munich shrugged off an injury and illness crisis to sweep past Heidenheim 4-0 on Sunday and go into the Bundesliga's winter break with a nine-point lead.

items.title: Sources: Alves buys Portuguese club, may play
items.summary: Former Barcelona and Brazil defender Dani Alves has finalised details to acquire Portuguese third division club Sporting Clube de SÃ£o JoÃ£o de Ver, sources told ESPN Brazil's Bruno Andrade.

items.title: Hearts' games vs Dundee Utd, St Mirren & Rangers live on Sky Sports
items.summary: Hearts' games away to Dundee United, St Mirren and Rangers are among the latest Scottish Premiership games to be added to the Sky Sports schedule.

items.title: 'Grote meneer' Reijnders past zich moeiteloos aan in de absolute top
items.summary: Tijjani Reijnders maakte afgelopen zomer de overstap van AC Milan naar Manchester City en past zich moeiteloos aan in de Premier League. Afgelopen weekend was hij tegen West Ham United met een doelpunt belangrijk voor de ploeg van Pep Guardiola. Reden genoeg om hem te bespreken in de rubriek de Nederlander van de Week.

items.title: Deze teams hebben een povere kerst: de slechtste hekkensluiters van Europa
items.summary: In Nederland is het winterstop, in sommige andere Europese landen ook, in andere landen is het dan weer bijna winterstop en er zijn ook competities die al voorbij zijn. De juiste tijd om de balans op te maken is altijd lastig te vinden, maar VI zet toch de slechtste hekkensluiters van Europa op een rijtje.

items.title: NEC verhuurt speler aan Dordrecht, AZ anticipeert op vertrek Parrott
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Heâ€™s back! Ally Pally hero Munyua returns and gets crowd bouncing!
items.summary: David Munyua returns to the Ally Pally stage for his second round match with Kevin Doets.

items.title: Heracles neemt enorm risico met verkoop Hornkamp
items.summary: Heracles Almelo gaat Jizz Hornkamp kwijtraken. De 27-jarige spits gaat zijn carriÃ¨re vervolgen bij AZ en laat daarmee een enorme leegte achter in het Asito Stadion. Heracles is als nummer zeventien van de Eredivisie de winterstop in gegaan en moet het in de tweede seizoenshelft stellen zonder de clubtopscorer. Over de risico's van de verkoop van Hornkamp.

items.title: Scott departs Hibs to replace Sadiku at Celtic Women
items.summary: Celtic have appointed Grant Scott as the club's new Women's head coach.

items.title: Precheur gone - so what's next for London City?
items.summary: When London City Lionesses sacked manager Jocelyn Precheur it sparked controversy - but they are a club who have always done things differently.

items.title: Sky Sports extends PGA Tour deal until 2029
items.summary: Sky and the PGA Tour have agreed a four-year extension to their long-standing partnership in the UK and Ireland through to the end of 2029.

items.title: Leverkusen level up as Hjulmand oversees rebuild after Ten Hag debacle
items.summary: A fightback win over RB Leipzig before the Christmas break is just reward for coach who faced a thankless task Leipzig might not be every Bundesliga fanâ€™s idea of a weekend idyll but as the sun set on 2025, the venue for the final Saturday night Topspiel of the year might have been the scene of a minor Christmas miracle. It had already been a worthy showpiece to draw the curtains on pre-Christmas Bundesliga but the end result â€“ achieved not without a smidgeon of controversy â€“ left us with a satisfying tale to tell by an open fire over holiday season. For Bayer Leverkusen can enjoy their brief break with a rosy glow of satisfaction with their win against a direct competitor a clear measure of how far they have come; or, if you like, a measure of how far Kasper Hjulmand has taken them. Leverkusen sit third over the bridge to the new year which, if we were to return to the closure of the summer transfer window, looked a long way off. Continue reading...

items.title: Glasner hopes to gee up jaded Palace as he eyes Carabao Cup revenge over Arsenal
items.summary: Tuesdayâ€™s quarter-final will be the Eaglesâ€™ 29th game of the season and Gabriel Jesus is set to line up against them Oliver Glasner could be forgiven for preferring to enjoy a rest with his family in Austria a few days before Christmas rather than preparing for Crystal Palaceâ€™s 29th game of the season â€“ a Carabao Cup quarter-final against Arsenal on Tuesday night. However, any suggestion that Palace may have to prioritise given they remain in four competitions was unsurprisingly dismissed. â€œNo, I donâ€™t think so,â€ said Glasner after his teamâ€™s 4-1 hammering by Leeds on Saturday. â€œIf somebody tells me that we lose on purpose, the next day Iâ€™m not the manager any more.â€ Continue reading...

items.title: Liverpool win again, but lose Isak to injury. Now what? Plus: BarÃ§a ride their luck, more
items.summary: Liverpool won a third straight game, but Alexander Isak's injury and some familiar issues mean the Reds still have a lot of work to do.

items.title: Villarreal tried everything against Barcelona â€“ except moving the game to Miami | Sid Lowe
items.summary: In a match mercifully on Spanish soil, Villarreal bombarded BarÃ§a but were undone by profligacy and ill-discipline Marcelino GarcÃ­a Toral came bounding down the steps like an excited schoolboy when the bell goes. He flew past the substitutes and staff, skidded left, and sprinted up the line all wide-eyed and excited, shaking his fists and beaming. He had gone 15 or 20 metres, maybe 25 when he realised â€“ just a fraction later than everyone else â€“ that something had gone wrong again. So Villarrealâ€™s manager put the brakes on and his head down, and turned back towards the bench feeling almost as silly as this was getting. This, he already suspected, was going to be one of those days. They had been playing 16 minutes and the goal Villarreal had scored, the goal Jules KoundÃ© scored for them, wasnâ€™t a goal at all. Just as the chance they made after 80 seconds wasnâ€™t, Nicolas PÃ©pÃ© putting wide from a yard out. Just as Ayoze PÃ©rezâ€™s opportunity on six minutes wasnâ€™t a goal, Tajon Buchananâ€™s effort on 13 wasnâ€™t, and Raphinhaâ€™s on nine minutes was. One moment â€“ a dash, a tumble and a penalty â€“ and from nowhere Villarreal trailed Barcelona. Now they were level again only for a raised flag to halt the managerâ€™s run as suddenly, the oh neatly summing up the afternoon when La Ligaâ€™s best teams met on the Mediterranean, not in Miami, and Barcelona beat Villarreal 2-0. Continue reading...

items.title: Should Van de Ven have been sent off for Isak tackle?
items.summary: Micky van de Ven faced no action for the challenge which led to Alexander Isak's injury in Liverpool's win at Tottenham - but did the officials make the right call?
